item.title: 通用磨坊公司季度销售额降幅低于预期
item.description: 本周三，谷物早餐、零食棒和宠物食品制造商通用磨坊公司（General Mills）公布的季度销售额降幅小于预期。【原文：Cheerios maker General Mills posted a smaller-than-expected drop in quarterly sales on Wednesday, backed by higher prices for its breakfast cereals, snack bars and pet food products that helped cushion a blow from slowing demand.】

item.title: 汉莎航空首席执行官表示希望尽快完成与 ITA 的交易
item.description: 汉莎航空首席执行官周三告诉记者，汉莎航空希望 "尽快 "完成与意大利 ITA 航空公司的交易。【原文：Lufthansa wants to close a deal with Italy's ITA Airways "as soon as possible," Lufthansa's Chief Executive told journalists on Wednesday, adding that he was optimistic ahead of an expected statement of objections from the European Commission on the deal.】

item.title: 波音已决定将 737 的月产量维持在 38 架以下 - 首席财务官称
item.description: 波音公司首席财务官布赖恩-韦斯特（Brian West）周三告诉分析师，波音已决定将737喷气机的月产量控制在38架以下，并且只接受供应商Spirit AeroSystems公司提供的完全合格的机身。【原文：Boeing has decided to keep 737 jet production below 38 per month and will only accept a fully conforming fuselage from supplier Spirit AeroSystems , CFO Brian West told analysts on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧洲航空公司首席执行官称行业整合至关重要
item.description: 在欧盟权衡新协议之际，英国航空公司（British Airways）所有者国际航空集团（IAG）和瑞安航空公司（Ryanair）的首席执行官周三表示，欧洲航空公司的进一步整合对于保持行业竞争力是必要的。【原文：Further consolidation of Europe's airlines was necessary to keep the industry competitive, the CEOs of British Airways owner IAG and Ryanair said on Wednesday, as the EU weighs a new deal.】

item.title: 盈利暴跌后，BioNTech 寄希望于癌症药物的上市
item.description: 德国生物技术公司（BioNTech）与辉瑞公司合作开发的 COVID-19 疫苗在大流行病期间被广泛使用。【原文：Germany's BioNTech , whose COVID-19 vaccine in partnership with Pfizer was widely used during the pandemic, reported on Wednesday a plunge in 2023 revenue and earnings as its focus shifts towards cancer drug development.】

item.title: 美联储降息信心可能动摇，但尚未被通胀击垮
item.description: 美联储官员在 1 月底的政策会议上离开时，一直在寻求 "更大的信心"，即通胀处于可持续的下降通道上，这是他们为确定美国央行何时可能开始降息而设定的一个明显松散的标准。【原文：Federal Reserve officials left their policy meeting in late January in search of "greater confidence" that inflation was on a sustainable downward path, a notably squishy standard they set for determining when the U.S. central bank might start cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 早间竞价美联储做出决定，七国集团为通货紧缩欢呼
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 独家报道：高管称东京海上有 100 亿美元用于潜在收购
item.description: 日本保险公司拓展国际业务的联席主管告诉路透社，东京海上可能斥资约 100 亿美元进行海外收购，并正在耐心跟踪世界各地的上市公司。【原文：Tokio Marine could potentially spend around $10 billion on overseas acquisitions and is patiently tracking public companies around the world, the co-head of the Japanese insurer's expanding international business told Reuters.】

item.title: 在激进分子斗争的关键时刻，迪斯尼获得了大牌明星的支持
item.description: 乔治-卢卡斯、杰米-戴蒙和沃尔特-迪士尼家族有什么共同之处？【原文：What do George Lucas, Jamie Dimon and the family of Walt Disney have in common?】

item.title: 波音首席财务官称已决定将 737 的月产量控制在 38 架以下
item.description: 波音公司首席财务官布赖恩-韦斯特（Brian West）周三告诉分析师，波音公司已决定将B737喷气机的月产量控制在38架以下，并且只接受供应商Spirit AeroSystems公司在华盛顿州工厂生产的完全合格的机身。【原文：Boeing has made the decision to keep B737 jet production below 38 per month, and will only accept a fully conforming fuselage from supplier Spirit AeroSystems at its Washington state factory, CFO Brian West told analysts on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国监管机构称梅赛德斯-奔驰将召回116,020辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes Benz）将召回116,020辆汽车，召回原因是48伏接地连接安全不当。【原文：Mercedes Benz will recall 116,020 vehicles due to an improperly secured 48-volt ground connection, the U.S National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国监管机构称克莱斯勒将召回超过 3.8 万辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周三表示，克莱斯勒将召回3.8万多辆汽车，原因是这些汽车的驾驶员安全气囊在发生碰撞时可能无法展开。【原文：Chrysler is recalling more than 38,000 vehicles due to an issue which can prevent the driver's airbag from deploying in a crash, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储决议前期货走低
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货走低，投资者在等待美联储会议的结果，预计该央行将维持借贷成本不变，并提供有关其货币政策轨迹的线索。【原文：U.S. stock index futures ticked lower on Wednesday as investors awaited the conclusion of the Federal Reserve's meeting where the central bank is expected to keep borrowing costs unchanged and provide cues on its monetary policy trajectory.】

item.title: 拉加德表示，欧洲央行即使在首次降息后也不能承诺利率路径
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）周三表示，即使欧洲央行开始降低借贷成本，也不能承诺预先设定的降息次数，因为这将取决于即将公布的数据。【原文：The European Central Bank cannot commit to a pre-set number of interest rate cuts even after it starts reducing borrowing costs as that will depend on incoming data, ECB President Christine Lagarde said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 台湾 2 月出口订单不及预期，受中国大陆和美国影响
item.description: 尽管人工智能应用需求强劲，但地缘政治的不确定性和高利率给前景蒙上了阴影。【原文：Taiwan's export orders fell in February as fewer working days during the Lunar New Year holiday limited productivity, with the outlook clouded by geopolitical uncertainty and high interest rates despite robust demand for AI applications.】

item.title: 美国顶级破产律师斯普雷根离开柯克兰，转投 Hilco
item.description: Hilco 在周二的一份声明中表示，美国顶级破产律师杰米-斯普雷雷根（Jamie Sprayregen）将离开 Kirkland & Ellis 卓越的企业重组业务部门，转投私人金融咨询公司 Hilco Global。【原文：Jamie Sprayregen, one of the top U.S. bankruptcy lawyers, is leaving Kirkland & Ellis's pre-eminent corporate restructuring practice for Hilco Global, a private financial advisory firm, Hilco said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 英特尔准备在美国四个州狂掷 1000 亿美元
item.description: 在获得 195 亿美元的联邦拨款和贷款后，英特尔正计划在美国四个州斥资 1,000 亿美元兴建和扩建工厂，并希望再获得 250 亿美元的税收减免。【原文：Intel is planning a $100 billion spending spree across four U.S. states to build and expand factories after securing $19.5 billion in federal grants and loans - and it hopes to secure another $25 billion in tax breaks.】

item.title: 英特尔从拜登处获得近 200 亿美元奖励，以提高美国芯片产量
item.description: 拜登政府周三表示，将向英特尔公司提供近 200 亿美元的赠款和贷款，以提高该公司的国内半导体芯片产量，这也是政府在补贴尖端芯片生产方面的最大一笔支出。【原文：The Biden administration said it is awarding Intel nearly $20 billion in grants and loans on Wednesday, supercharging the company's domestic semiconductor chip output and marking the government's largest outlay to subsidize leading-edge chip production.】

item.title: 2024 年迄今外国公司在俄罗斯的 "退出税 "支付额为 3.85 亿美元
item.description: 在线预算数据显示，今年迄今为止，离开俄罗斯的外国公司为俄罗斯预算提供了 357 亿卢布（3.85 亿美元）的出口捐款，已经超过了全年预期。【原文：Foreign companies leaving Russia have made exit contributions to the Russian budget of 35.7 billion roubles ($385 million) so far this year, online budget data showed, already surpassing full-year expectations.】

item.title: 中国腾讯收入增长乏力，计划双倍回购
item.description: 随着中国经济放缓，中国腾讯控股公司周三公布第四季度收入增长7%，低于分析师预期，并表示预计今年股票回购至少翻一番。【原文：China's Tencent Holdings posted a 7% rise in fourth-quarter revenue on Wednesday, trailing analysts' expectations, as China’s economic slowdown takes a toll, and said it was expecting to at least double its share buybacks this year.】

item.title: 瑞士金融监管机构计划今年对瑞银集团进行压力测试
item.description: 瑞士金融监管机构 FINMA 周三表示，该机构计划对瑞银集团进行 40 次审查，并在今年对该银行进行两次压力测试，因为瑞银集团在 2023 年接管了竞争对手瑞士信贷银行，这加剧了人们对 "大到不能倒 "的贷款机构的担忧。【原文：Swiss financial regulator FINMA said on Wednesday it plans to carry out 40 reviews of UBS and two stress tests this year on the bank after it took over rival Credit Suisse in 2023, which heightened concerns about 'too big to fail' lenders.】

item.title: 法国竞争监管机构对谷歌处以 2.5 亿欧元罚款
item.description: 法国竞争监督机构周三表示，对 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司处以 2.5 亿欧元（合 2.7173 亿美元）的罚款，原因是该公司在与媒体出版商的关系中违反了欧盟知识产权规则，并对该公司的人工智能服务表示担忧。【原文：France's competition watchdog on Wednesday said it fined Alphabet's Google 250 million euros ($271.73 million) for breaches linked to EU intellectual property rules in its relationship with media publishers, citing concerns about the company's AI service.】

item.title: 古驰销售额急剧下降，中国成为焦点
item.description: 开云集团（Kering）周三开盘股价预计将下跌，此前该公司警告称，由于亚洲市场疲软，其明星品牌古驰（Gucci）第一季度的销售额将下降约 20%。【原文：Shares of Kering are expected to open down on Wednesday, after the company warned first quarter sales at its star label Gucci would drop by around 20% due to weakness in Asia.】

item.title: 龙沙将以 12 亿美元收购罗氏在美国的生物制剂生产基地
item.description: 瑞士合同药品生产商龙沙（Lonza）周三表示，该公司已签署协议，将以 12 亿美元现金从制药商罗氏（Roche）手中收购基因泰克（Genentech）位于加利福尼亚州瓦卡维尔（Vacaville）的生产设施。【原文：Swiss contract drug manufacturer Lonza said on Wednesday it has signed an agreement to acquire the Genentech manufacturing facility in Vacaville, California, from drugmaker Roche for $1.2 billion in cash.】

item.title: 早间竞价：英国通胀数据逼近，日元再遭重挫
item.description: Vidya Ranganathan 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Vidya Ranganathan】

item.title: 受美国降息希望和出口强劲影响，亚洲债券吸引大量资金流入
item.description: 受美国联邦储备委员会将在今年晚些时候降息的预期以及该地区强劲出口的提振，2 月份亚洲债券吸引了三个月来最大的月度资金流入。【原文：Asian bonds attracted their largest monthly inflow in three months in February, helped by expectations that the U.S. Federal Reserve would cut rates later this year, and also boosted by the region's strong exports.】

item.title: 亿万富翁马蒂森增持澳大利亚赌场运营商星际娱乐公司股份
item.description: 周三的一份交易所文件显示，澳大利亚亿万富翁布鲁斯-马蒂森（Bruce Mathieson）旗下的一家公司已将其在赌场运营商星际娱乐公司（Star Entertainment）的持股比例从 6% 增至 8.21%。【原文：A firm owned by Australian billionaire Bruce Mathieson has increased its stake in casino operator Star Entertainment to 8.21% from 6%, an exchange filing showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 苹果公司老板蒂姆-库克访问上海，中国销售面临压力
item.description: 苹果公司首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）周三在其微博上发文称，他目前正在上海访问。【原文：Apple CEO Tim Cook said he is currently visiting Shanghai, according to a post on his Weibo account on Wednesday.】

item.title: 三星电子预计先进芯片封装业务的销售额将达到或超过 1 亿美元
item.description: 三星电子联席首席执行官 Kye-Hyun Kyung 周三表示，预计今年先进芯片封装业务的收入将达到或超过 1 亿美元。【原文：Samsung Electronics expects $100 million or more of revenue from its advanced chip packaging business this year, co-CEO Kye-Hyun Kyung said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国央行改组货币政策委员会
item.description: 中国央行表示，已对货币政策委员会进行改组，包括证券监管机构负责人吴庆、央行副行长宣昌能和两名新的学术委员。【原文：China's central bank said it has reshuffled its monetary policy committee to include securities regulator head Wu Qing, vice central bank chief Xuan Changneng and two new academic members.】
